text.text_translated: The Hunger Games is an annual event which the Capitol uses to remind the districts that they are being punished for fighting against the government. Every year, one boy and one girl aged 12 to 18 are chosen from each district by lottery to compete in a battle where only one person can survive. The chosen teenagers are called "tributes". Tributes are the people selected to compete. The whole nation is forced to watch the event on television.

feedback.feedback: PASS. This is an excellent simplification that successfully meets all B1 criteria. Factual Integrity: The output is factually identical to the original text. All key details are preserved. Meaning and Fidelity: The high MeaningBERT (0.87) and BERTScore (0.98) confirm that the core message and key phrasing have been maintained effectively. CEFR Compliance: The text correctly registers as B1. Qualitative Analysis: The handling of the keyword 'tributes' is exemplary. Adding the sentence 'Tributes are the people selected to compete' provides a clear and direct definition for the target reader. The replacement of 'rebelling' with 'fighting against the government' is also a strong choice that clarifies the meaning without losing nuance. The overall text is clear, accurate, and well-structured for a B1 audience.
